block.p: The YankeeNets, the sports-based company that owns the Yankees, Nets and Devils, donated $500,000 to the United States Naval Academy last week to establish the Dr. John J. McMullen Endowment for the Brigade of Midshipmen.

McMullen, who sold the Devils to YankeeNets for $175 million at the end of last season, is a 1940 graduate of Navy. Several years ago, he donated $1 million to establish the Distinguished Chair of Leadership at the academy.
McMullen said yesterday that the gift from YankeeNets would support academics, athletics, leadership, character development and admissions at Navy.

When I was there, it was so rigorous and difficult that my class had 650 and ended up with 425, he said. A lot of that was not only academics but discipline. Everybody has a certain degree of leadership. It's important to bring it out and make sure it's practiced.
